reviews.title: Worst experience in 25 years
reviews.text: Avoid staying in the main portion of this hotel as though as your life depended on it. Despite the brochures and the web photos, this tiny hotel with tiny hotel rooms has paper thin walls (NOT sound proof-as was claimed-we could hear conversations from the lobby from the second floor!), filthy (rooms were not cleaned when we checked in, despite checking in after the check in time, the single chair in our room clearly falling apart, wallpaper peeling, mismatched, patched, windows filthy, carpets terribly stained), and was terribly served (elevators out of service for most of our stay, and despite many prejudices about Paris and the French, Parisians can be quite charming and friendly-with the exception of the hotel staff of the Unic Renoir, for some reason). And by the way-the parking which the hotel claims it has? It lost the contract with a neighboring garage last year-you'lle have to go to a city garage-quite a hike if you have baggage and children. I have been a visitor to Paris for 25 years and have enjoyed every single visit-but there are no conditions under which I would recommend this hotel. The staff and management ought to be ashamed.

reviews.title: Warning! Utter con - beware before you book
reviews.text: This is a delightful small hotel with a friendly, accomodating staff. it's well-placed on a quiet, pleasant street near Montparnasse station. I honestly don't understand some people's negative reviews. Perhaps they've never stayed in New York, London or other major cities where the hotel rooms tend to be slightly small. My room was clean, adequate and delightfully air-conditioned during a heat wave. I told them I had work to do, so they gave me an ultra- quiet room on back overlooking a courtyard. The staff made me feel welcome and at home. I consider this place a find, and would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here 5 nights during the first week of August, 2005. This was part of a 5-week trip through Italy and France (Normandie and Paris) with a 5-day break to attend a conference in Britain. I rented two rooms at the Unic Hotel, one for us and another for our young adult children. They had problems two nights in a row with loud people in a nearby room. I can honestly say that one can just about make out the conversations of people in neighboring rooms when they were speaking in normal tones. The room has some soundproofing to windows, but it was useless on a Saturday night with loud drunken folks at a nearby creperie till beyond 1 a.m. The hotel is aware of the noise problems and it is posted on all floors to be quiet inside the rooms. At another time of year, when there are less tourists on the street and more locals, I imagine that noise would be less of a problem.
reviews.title: Beware of paper-thin walls
Pleasantly surprised !
reviews.text: Very clean place, but very small rooms. We are small people. My husband is about 68-1/2 inches in height and is thin and his head would touch the lower part of the ceiling in the shower. Very little room to move about in the shower. If you are heavier than petite or have any sort of problems with arthritis whereby you cannot easily bend inside a shower, this is not the place for you.

reviews.title: Bigger charlatans I have ever met! Beware of the scam...
reviews.text: I love Paris and have visited many times. Usually, we are a party of just the two of us and have found it reasonable to rent an apartment (studio) rather than stay in a hotel. Because we had two other adults with us during thios trip, we found it difficult to find a large enough apartment to accommodate all of us without astronomical prices. That is why we chose hotel rooms this time. In the future, we will revert back to renting in a Parisian neighborhood. It's more fun to do that because of opportunity to meet locals.

reviews.title: So much better than the reviews!
reviews.text: Also, there was about 10 inches of space between the foot of the bed and the wall. We managed fine, but again, we are small people. If that does not fit your description, consider another place.
